businessProfile.name: Red Top Pizza - Detroit Style (Sage Hill)
businessProfile.address: 3950 Sage Hill Dr NW #330, Calgary, AB T3R 2A4, Canada
businessProfile.formatted_address: 3950 Sage Hill Dr NW #330, Calgary, AB T3R 2A4, Canada

reviews.text:
Placed order online and it was ready to go when I arrived to the shop! Bonus for me as it was BOGO50% online! üôÇ the staff member was very quick to the front and friendly. I ordered a cheese pizza for my kids (which they loved!). Super cheesy and delicious.
My husband and I shared a square Corktown Groove and it was delicious! Nice big rectangular pieces. Full of toppings. The crust was nice and crispy with an abundance of toast cheesy bits. The pickles, spinach, feta, bacon and a drizzle of honey may sound like an odd combo but it was amazing! The flavours worked so well together!

Absolutely delicious pizza!! It‚Äôs hard for us to break away from our usual pizza place but we were hearing such great reviews from people we knew so we had to try. The ingredients are fresh which make the flavours mesh really well together. The real test is the next day reheat,, and it was just as good !!! The service was fantastic and the person who gave me the pizza was very kind and accommodating! Will definitely be back (:

Wow, this was easily one of the best pizzas I‚Äôve had in years! I‚Äôd only ever seen ‚ÄúDetroit-style‚Äù pizza on TV, but trying it in person was a total game-changer. We went for their signature square pie, "The Good Pie," and it was absolutely incredible.

The melted cheese caramelized right to the edge, forming this thick, crispy, cheesy crust‚Äîpure heaven. The sauce layered over the cheese, pepperoni, sausage, and jalape√±os created an explosion of flavor in every bite. I was a bit worried the crust would be too thick, but the balance between the toppings and crust was absolutely spot-on.

I can‚Äôt wait to come back and explore the rest of the menu!

It's hard to find Detroit style pizza here and these guys do a pretty decent job at it. Their round pizza is also good which I did prefer over the Detroit style, but I think either is worth a shot for anyone interested in this style of pizza.

First time trying I seen the reviews and had to give it a shot! Yes it is delicious, the flavours all compliment eachother very well the hot honey isn‚Äôt very spicy just a hint of spice ,but it‚Äôs good. The crust has a good crisp too it , and the pizza sauce is definitely unique to others pizza places but I really enjoy it . I‚Äôll definitely come back , only thing I noticed is the slices of jalape√±o are a bit thick slightly thinner would be nice. Overall 4.6/5 pizza !!

recentReviews.text:
Red Top is probably my most favourite pizza place, and we only discovered it by accident and now we get it all the time.  Big shout-out to our chefs, Aly amd Haleema.  Our pizzas are usually pretty damn good, but tonight's pizzas tasted exceptionally better, so whatever they're doing they're doing it right!

Note to everyone, the proper way to get pizzas here is with a big party so you can try all the different ones at once!  (My personal favs are the Detroiter and the Pesto, but they're all really good.)

We ordered pizza here for a games night and the pizza was top notch.  All pizza‚Äôs were hot, crispy and the ingredients were well proportioned and generous!   We all enjoyed them so much.  The way pizza should be!   Pizza chefs Aly and Haleema are absolutely spot on!  Thanks so much for making our night special.

Have to get the 4/8 square Detroit style pizzas (good pie and pesto pie are amazing). Might be the best pizza in the city, at least the best Detroit style (Neapolitan and NY style pizzas exist that can compete but that's different). Mostly halal as well, just ask for halal and they will let you know if any of the toppings aren't, for those they'll offer to substitute for an appropriate topping.

detailedReviews.author: Derrick Woo
detailedReviews.text:
Red Top is probably my most favourite pizza place, and we only discovered it by accident and now we get it all the time.  Big shout-out to our chefs, Aly amd Haleema.  Our pizzas are usually pretty damn good, but tonight's pizzas tasted exceptionally better, so whatever they're doing they're doing it right!

Note to everyone, the proper way to get pizzas here is with a big party so you can try all the different ones at once!  (My personal favs are the Detroiter and the Pesto, but they're all really good.)

detailedReviews.author: Lee Mosca
detailedReviews.text: We ordered pizza here for a games night and the pizza was top notch.  All pizza‚Äôs were hot, crispy and the ingredients were well proportioned and generous!   We all enjoyed them so much.  The way pizza should be!   Pizza chefs Aly and Haleema are absolutely spot on!  Thanks so much for making our night special.

detailedReviews.author: Isabella
detailedReviews.text: Hella good Detroit Style pizza!!

detailedReviews.author: Mahad Imran
detailedReviews.text: Have to get the 4/8 square Detroit style pizzas (good pie and pesto pie are amazing). Might be the best pizza in the city, at least the best Detroit style (Neapolitan and NY style pizzas exist that can compete but that's different). Mostly halal as well, just ask for halal and they will let you know if any of the toppings aren't, for those they'll offer to substitute for an appropriate topping.

detailedReviews.author: Rick Kaczkowski
detailedReviews.text: Pizza tasted good...minimal toppings.  Don't think I would order from here again.

detailedReviews.author: Offoda
detailedReviews.text: Good stuff: the 4 Slice is a "small" for your 22 Canadian pesos but you get a lot of bang for the buck... Mostly the dough, but that's as advertised: 3 adults full on 5 slices & we usually down 2x Domino's mediums. Had the cheese steak and the donair & were not disappointed. Had to unhinge the jaw to accommodate though, so heading to do a dentist review nextüòÅ Dad said the guy at the till was a hoot, so extra kudos there üëç

detailedReviews.author: David Yuan
detailedReviews.text: It's hard to find Detroit style pizza here and these guys do a pretty decent job at it. Their round pizza is also good which I did prefer over the Detroit style, but I think either is worth a shot for anyone interested in this style of pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Scott Speers
detailedReviews.text:
Really bad pizza!
Wasn‚Äôt even close to authentic Detroit style pizza. Kinda pan fried a thick crust, threw a few thin toppings on and covered it with some Heinz pizza sauce out of a can. 2/10

detailedReviews.author: Andrew Cao
detailedReviews.text: Delicious pizza

detailedReviews.author: Herman Ma
detailedReviews.text: A take out pizza shop in sage Hill.  Was recommended to give it a try by a friend that lives close by.  I didn't order ahead of time, so had to wait for my order for about 20 mins.  The gentleman that was making the pizza was generous to offer me a free slice while I was waiting.  They have regular round pies and Detroit style squares.  I ordered one of each to try and was satisfied on both of them.  The Detroit style 4 slice square is larger then it sounds and the pizza is light and fluffy.  Good to have another pizza shop I can try that is also close to my house.

detailedReviews.author: rayden nash
detailedReviews.text: Ordered 78 plus for two pizzas . They arrived at my house smelling bad and burnt. But I have to say they made up for the problems. I would order again

detailedReviews.author: Janie Vu
detailedReviews.text: First time trying Detroit style pizza and got the 8 square Detroiter. I usually go for a NY-style pizza but this might be my next favorite!! The crust is crunchy and also reheats so well. It has a nice flavour like garlic bread! I also liked the sauce on top, it left the bread super crispy without being soggy. Will be back again soon!

detailedReviews.author: Steffany & Jamie
detailedReviews.text: A sadly disappointing experiences. I had high hopes for a great meaty deep dish pizza and unfortunately I was given a pizza made up of 85% dough. The flavors of the pizza were good - the the two star review relates directly to the ultra thick crust. If I wanted to eat a loaf of bread I would have gone to my local bakery and ordered a fresh of focaccia paired with a nice olive oil and balsamic. And it would have been a heck of a lot less expensive.

detailedReviews.author: Zayne Hoffman
detailedReviews.text: Great Detroit style pizza will have again and the kids loved it

detailedReviews.author: Jessie Kular
detailedReviews.text: The pizza was SOOOO delicious and filling. The service was the cherry on top! What a cute spot.

detailedReviews.author: Michelle Riccetto
detailedReviews.text: Oh my god this pizza is unreal

detailedReviews.author: Laura Cates
detailedReviews.text:
Ordered thru Uber eats.  Arrived not hot.  114  degrees.  Very. Very. Few toppings.   We thought we were ordering a loaded pizza.  Barely a skim of toppings.  Flavor is good.  Sauce is
great.  Dough is fluffy and very good.   Disappointed in temperature and amount of toppings in a 40 dollar pizza.

detailedReviews.author: manmeet gulati
detailedReviews.text: Guy was so rude

detailedReviews.author: Jessica Renaud
detailedReviews.text:
Ordered for my mom before her big moving day and let me tell you, it's the best pizza you can get. Period. Toppings are fresh and VERY generously loaded. But that dough! It's like biting in a thick and airy garlic bread, it melts in your mouth. It also tastes as good the day after.
Keep up the good work.

~ The green olives gal

detailedReviews.author: Colin Peterson
detailedReviews.text: Great Pizza!

detailedReviews.author: Kelen R
detailedReviews.text:
I love this pizza.
It's very filling.

detailedReviews.author: Lisa Willis
detailedReviews.text: So awesome to finally have an option in the area for deep dish pizza! The food was amazing & the staff at Red Top are so friendly and helpful. Will definitely be going back soon :)

detailedReviews.author: Yonas Kif
detailedReviews.text: Excellent place for slices at lunch

detailedReviews.author: Osisami Olukayode
detailedReviews.text: Friendly staff

detailedReviews.author: aaron wu
detailedReviews.text: got a pizza there nothing special , kinda pricey compared to other pizza spots

detailedReviews.author: Frank Peresta
detailedReviews.text: Was excited to try but not a great Detroit style pizza. Minimal amount of cheese and the dough/sauce tastes store bought. For $50 bucks (2 cheese pizzasI expected something good. Try POW Pizza Detroit style...that is a quality pie.

detailedReviews.author: Mike Fischer
detailedReviews.text: Excellent pizza, great customer service. I‚Äôd love to see more locations pop up around the city. Try the Corktown Groove.

detailedReviews.author: Shirley Mappala
detailedReviews.text: Absolutely delicious pizza!! It‚Äôs hard for us to break away from our usual pizza place but we were hearing such great reviews from people we knew so we had to try. The ingredients are fresh which make the flavours mesh really well together. The real test is the next day reheat,, and it was just as good !!! The service was fantastic and the person who gave me the pizza was very kind and accommodating! Will definitely be back (:

detailedReviews.author: Steve Wolfe
detailedReviews.text: Fantastic pizza. The Detroiter was so complete and tastefully executed.

detailedReviews.author: Chris Holman
detailedReviews.text: Was certainly reluctant to try Red Top due to the distance they are. Took the plunge anyway. Glad I did. Ordered the Detroiter (via Uber Eats). Downside (at night fault of Red Top), took about 45 minutes from their door to mine. When the driver dropped it off on my entrance...he literally dropped it. Also, no thermal bag so no idea if he used the bag during transport. Also, something wet was on top of the box. Again, Red Top had absolutely no control over this. Upon arrival, the Pizza was cold (figured it would be), so I re heated it in the oven. It's was pretty tasty. Nice flavor, and the crust was great. Detroit style Pizza is a nice treat/change from time to time. I certainly plan on ordering again. Any chance you guys opening a second location near DT? Yep, I know, I'm kind of selfish. I live DT and don't have a car.

detailedReviews.author: Mac Andres
detailedReviews.text:
Delicious, but so salty you can only eat a few pieces.

My first time trying Detroit style. Would love it if there was maybe half as much sodium. Let the ingredients shine.

detailedReviews.author: Justin Cook
detailedReviews.text:
Really great pizza, the closest to pow pizza I have found since they closed or moved.
Really delicious with decent quality ingredients.
The cheesy edge of crust is to die for!!

detailedReviews.author: John Sun
detailedReviews.text: I was looking to try some Detroit Style pizza and came acroos this place after a few searches. I've never had it before so I can't say how authentic it was, but the pizzas I ordered tasted great and were well dressed for the most part. We had ordered their special "Pesto Pie" and "The Good Pie". The pesto pie was our favourite with the unique flavour it had. The good pie and its hot honey drizzle was still tasty with a nice kick too. We picked up and the service was very quick. The location is among a bunch of condo construction so may be easy to miss. Overall a positive first experience with Detroit style pizza!

detailedReviews.author: Maggie W
detailedReviews.text:
Placed order online and it was ready to go when I arrived to the shop! Bonus for me as it was BOGO50% online! üôÇ the staff member was very quick to the front and friendly. I ordered a cheese pizza for my kids (which they loved!). Super cheesy and delicious.
My husband and I shared a square Corktown Groove and it was delicious! Nice big rectangular pieces. Full of toppings. The crust was nice and crispy with an abundance of toast cheesy bits. The pickles, spinach, feta, bacon and a drizzle of honey may sound like an odd combo but it was amazing! The flavours worked so well together!

detailedReviews.author: Layne Pennell
detailedReviews.text:
Great Detroit Style pizza! I used to live an hour from Detroit so I know the style. Great sauce and cooked perfectly.

My family and I will be ordering again soon.

Well done Red Top!!

detailedReviews.author: Faris Alrabi
detailedReviews.text: Love this place. Wanted to try something other than the usual spots I go to, and gave Red Top a shot. This place did not disappoint! The pizzas taste very fresh. The quality of the ingredients is very evident. It's Detroit-style, so the cuts are bigger and thicker; almost pie-like. Just something to keep in mind. They are mostly Halal with the exception of a few options, so definitely a plus for Halal-conscious consumers. The pricing is above market average, but they do have BOGO deals often enough, and I found it to be worth it. Overall, I would definitely recommend this place and will most definitely be coming back myself!

detailedReviews.author: Risqyz
detailedReviews.text: First time trying I seen the reviews and had to give it a shot! Yes it is delicious, the flavours all compliment eachother very well the hot honey isn‚Äôt very spicy just a hint of spice ,but it‚Äôs good. The crust has a good crisp too it , and the pizza sauce is definitely unique to others pizza places but I really enjoy it . I‚Äôll definitely come back , only thing I noticed is the slices of jalape√±o are a bit thick slightly thinner would be nice. Overall 4.6/5 pizza !!

detailedReviews.author: Wander Dazy
detailedReviews.text:
Great and fast pizza for lunch or on the go. Dough was even good. At about
$ 5.25 for a slice and pop good deal.

detailedReviews.author: Stefan Kendel
detailedReviews.text: Detroit style is awesome.  Great pizza, have ordered twice now.   Every pie has been delicious.

detailedReviews.author: Jason
detailedReviews.text: this pizza that I'm eating right now is the best pizza I have ever had in my entire life.

detailedReviews.author: trevor wright
detailedReviews.text: Detroiter Rocks!

detailedReviews.author: Samantha Foster
detailedReviews.text:
Ordered this pizza on a whim while in Calgary from the rave reviews. We live in Cochrane so I drove home before we got to try it. We ordered the Detroit style pepperoni which was unbelievable! And the round all meat pizza, again really good!
Will definitely be back to grab another pizza in the near future!

detailedReviews.author: Chris Johnson
detailedReviews.text: All meat 8 square was good but salty. Could only eat 1 pcs per sitting.

detailedReviews.author: DailyDrivenMuscle
detailedReviews.text: Awesome pizza, you will not be disappointed! Ignore the people who cleary don't understand that Detroit pizza will be different in style but taste is awesomeüëå If you like original style pizza buy the original but don't complain like a child. Will be back!! Great pizza!!

detailedReviews.author: Jen D'Acey
detailedReviews.text: Delicious but pricey

detailedReviews.author: Jennifer Taylor
detailedReviews.text:
Edit - Red Top pizza reached out and we had a good conversation about the order. We agreed that it may have been an off night and the restaurant wanted to make things right. I ordered again and the pizza was much improved. Too garlicky for me (but that's a personal preference) however the topping were good and these cheese was generous.

I want to add that the management was very open to the feedback and was eager to show us what they can do. Thank you for your help!

Ordered two Detroit style pizzas for delivery through Skip. The pizza's had minimal toppings and you almost could not even find the cheese. The pizza's were all crust and dough. This was our first time ordering and we were excited for a Detroit style experience but we're sorely disappointed.

detailedReviews.author: Aneesh K
detailedReviews.text: Are you offering any vegan pizzas?

detailedReviews.author: George Campagne
detailedReviews.text: Nice change from regular pizzas

detailedReviews.author: Surreal Developments
detailedReviews.text: Had the good pie! Great pizza. Staff is friendly!

detailedReviews.author: Jerry Abbas
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza I had in a while! Just the perfect amount of cheese on it

detailedReviews.author: Don Yang
detailedReviews.text: Super crispy cheese without being burnt-like. Unique topping combos. Lots of fresh takes on pizza & tastes great too. Must try!

detailedReviews.author: Irwin P
detailedReviews.text: This is the third time I've been here. The best pizza in Calgary it's all about the crust  and toppings.I highly recommend this place and their food

detailedReviews.author: Turja Kundu
detailedReviews.text: I tried the BBQ Chicken Pizza, very very good. My whole family loved it 10/10 for sure try load the pizza up with toppings!

detailedReviews.author: Ash D
detailedReviews.text: One of the best pizza places in town. The service is really great as well.

detailedReviews.author: vijaydeep Singh
detailedReviews.text: So yummy so tasty üòã

detailedReviews.author: Dipen Batra
detailedReviews.text: The Literal Best and Most Unique Pizza I Have Tasted In Calgary

detailedReviews.author: Vadim Kagan
detailedReviews.text: Excellent Detroit style pizza, a little bit more expensive but totally worth it. Tons of toppings and an excellent crispy crust.

detailedReviews.author: Jesse Reid
detailedReviews.text:
Great pizza crust is wonderful good value for money lots of topping and the calzone are large and great deal price.
Shaz is also great customer service and makes a great pizza

detailedReviews.author: Thanh H
detailedReviews.text:
Wow, this was easily one of the best pizzas I‚Äôve had in years! I‚Äôd only ever seen ‚ÄúDetroit-style‚Äù pizza on TV, but trying it in person was a total game-changer. We went for their signature square pie, "The Good Pie," and it was absolutely incredible.

The melted cheese caramelized right to the edge, forming this thick, crispy, cheesy crust‚Äîpure heaven. The sauce layered over the cheese, pepperoni, sausage, and jalape√±os created an explosion of flavor in every bite. I was a bit worried the crust would be too thick, but the balance between the toppings and crust was absolutely spot-on.

I can‚Äôt wait to come back and explore the rest of the menu!

detailedReviews.author: Dj Dee
detailedReviews.text: Great food

detailedReviews.author: Josh Murray
detailedReviews.text:
Awesome food with great ingredients!
We frequent this spot weekly, the fries are great and the portions are awesome.

4 square pizza is very filling so not underestimate it.
Great value for the best pizza in the NW.

detailedReviews.author: Thamy Darwish
detailedReviews.text: Really amazing quality pizza. I ordered a bunch of pizzas from here for a New Year‚Äôs party I was having, and despite being quite late on the pickup time, the pizzas still tasted amazing. Owner is super friendly and negotiable when it comes to big orders. This places deserves 10 stars for quality and service.

detailedReviews.author: Kim Wardrop
detailedReviews.text: This place has delicious pizza made fast! They are friendly and reliable. Highly recommend trying their orig8nal pizzas--they all taste amazing!

detailedReviews.author: Sabir Turkman
detailedReviews.text:
Best pizza in NW
Great food, great service

detailedReviews.author: Haris Ahmad
detailedReviews.text: This has become my new favourite Pizza spot in Calgary. Not only is the pizza amazing (the Detroiter especially) but so is the service. Every time I've ordered I've been greeted with a smile no matter how close to closing I am, and one time the guy who runs it at the front even gave me a pizza on the house. Love this place and keep up the great work!

detailedReviews.author: hanan sweety
detailedReviews.text: First time ever trying Red Top Pizza and I am soo glad I did!!! I wasn‚Äôt able to eat dinner tonight and at around 12:15 am came across this pizza place on skip. Decided to check the reviews and even though most were great I was hesitant. Had a lot of bad experiences with ordering on skip late hours. Usually felt like most servers don‚Äôt care after a certain time. I called in to make sure it was halal as well as time of delivery stop. I literally had 10 min to order. The person on the phone was super friendly so I felt a lot more comfortable to order. I got the 10‚Äù Detroiter and it was delicious!!! Honestly 1 of the best pizza‚Äôs I‚Äôve had for years! And for them to make it right before closing was top notch! I‚Äôm from states and felt like the pizza (as well as other food spots) was lacking here. But y‚Äôall did the damnnn thannnng! Keep it up!

detailedReviews.author: Max Rodionov
detailedReviews.text:
Great place to visit.
Excellent pizza

detailedReviews.author: L. P.
detailedReviews.text: Was excited to try a new pizza place. Got sick after eating here. Never coming back again. Will be forwarding a complaint to the AHS

detailedReviews.author: Ric Pelkey
detailedReviews.text:
December 4th Update:

Now I've lost interest in this place. I ordered two 8 square Detroit styles for myself and three friends visiting last night. This was their first time trying a Detroit style which I raved about. But this place is refusing to address an issue that many people have complained about in their reviews. And that is the skimpy amount of toppings.

The consistency here is poor. I spoke to the owner once about this and he apologized, offered me a free pizza and made things right. But......... then the consistency does not remain.

I'm pissed off now. This was their chance to get three new customers, but they failed. The Zeus had plenty of chicken but only paper thin slices of ham which we could not taste. The Arabian (Donair) was worse. One paper thin slice of donair meat which again, you couldn't even taste. So cheap with the toppings. I might as well buy a "Hot and Ready" pizza from Little Caesars. There's not much toppings on it either, but at least it doesn't cost $32!

Obviously they cannot get this problem under control and will now continue to lose customers. I've read though the reviews and many others have complained about this. Eventually this will hurt the business. Very sad that at times they nail this pizza, and other times it's just so disappointing.

Pic shows different angles of my pizza as I took bites. You'll see a little sliver of a donair and me peeking through the center in one pic. Grab a magnifying glass so you can see it.

Compare to my last review below. This is how inconsistency can change someone's view.

Last Review:

The owner knows what he's doing, and travels to other cities and countries to experience their pizzas. In my opinion he's a pizza expert!. He is passionate about pizza, and makes an AMAZING Detroit style. I grew up close to Detroit (Ontario side) and know that what he is doing here in Calgary is legitimate. Don't listen to the other reviewers complaining about the crust thickness, cheese, toppings, etc because they have no clue what they are talking about. I doubt they've even had a Detroit Style from the source in Detroit or Michigan before, but yet here they are flapping their gums and complaining. If you've never had one before then you are in for a treat. Understand that the crust is different from other pizzas, it's caramelized around the edges (delicious), uses brick cheese, and finishes off with the sauce on the top. The only pizza it should be compared to is another Detroit Style Pizza. Order one with an open mind, and you'll be hooked. Absolutely Delicious!! I LOVE this place.

detailedReviews.author: Logan R
detailedReviews.text: Amazing pizza with just the right amount of toppings. Lots of flavour and crunchy edges on the crust. Best deep dish I've had in the city. The sauce is on top (red top) and it's really good. Definitely try it.

detailedReviews.author: Sara B
detailedReviews.text: Amazing halal pizza!!! The crust was so delicious, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, and the sauce was perfectly seasoned - family was so excited about it. Definitely returning for more whenever I need my Detroit style pizza fix!

detailedReviews.author: zaineb almm
detailedReviews.text: Ordered takeout from here and the staff was so friendly and had my order ready on time, my pizza was crispy on the outside and perfectly chewy in the inside, i‚Äôll definitely be back for more

detailedReviews.author: James Lutzko
detailedReviews.text: I would have been better off to go to little Caesars. The pizza was over priced, toppings nonexsitent, no cheese.This company needs to learn how to make pizza. Worst pizza I‚Äôve ever had. Very disappointed

detailedReviews.author: Lynn McCartney
detailedReviews.text:
Nothing is easier than ordering pizza on moving day.
LOTS of quality, quantity of toppings, taste, in the Hawaiian.
I will be back!

detailedReviews.author: Danny Gates
detailedReviews.text:
Decided to give it a try and was pleasantly pleased. Pizza was loaded and filled with flavour!
Service was super friendly

detailedReviews.author: Tyler
detailedReviews.text:
If I could give this place 0 stars I would. I have never seen such a small pizza in my life, and for nearly $40 after tax I would describe my experience as "depressing".

I got the 8-square pizza and you could easily have fit 2 in the box. It was not enough food for two hungry adults and I could have finished it myself.

That's not to mention the fact that the pizza itself was mostly oily dough with an underwhelming amount of toppings...

detailedReviews.author: Maliha Fatima
detailedReviews.text: We opted for the Arabian and it was one of the best pizzas I‚Äôve ever had! Customer service was also amazing and I‚Äôll definitely be going back.

detailedReviews.author: Sara Kazmi
detailedReviews.text: I tried the Arabian pizza and really enjoyed it. The crust is crispy and everything is really flavourful. Excellent customer service, huge menu & delicious food!

detailedReviews.author: Nigel K
detailedReviews.text: Found my new favorite pizza place.

detailedReviews.author: Amanda K
detailedReviews.text: It's still delicious but this time ordering the Detroiter I did notice that there was no little pepperoni cups on top? Not sure if they completely changed the type of pepperoni they use but it did make a difference

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers have positive experiences overall. Your 4.5/5 rating from 100 recent reviews shows solid satisfaction with room for growth.

strengthsPerceived: Customers love the unique and authentic Detroit-style pizza, especially the crunchy crust and flavorful sauce that reheats well. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The chefs, Aly and Haleema, receive consistent praise for their exceptional pizza-making skills, making each dining experience special. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
Generous portion sizes and value for money, with pizzas that are filling and satisfying. - Boostly marketing services can amplify this
improvementOpportunities: Consistent complaints about minimal toppings and poor value for money - review management can address this concern
Negative reviews impacting reputation - review management can address this concern
Poor online visibility and competition with other pizza spots - SEO services can solve this visibility issue

positive.author: Derrick Woo
positive.text:
Red Top is probably my most favourite pizza place, and we only discovered it by accident and now we get it all the time.  Big shout-out to our chefs, Aly amd Haleema.  Our pizzas are usually pretty damn good, but tonight's pizzas tasted exceptionally better, so whatever they're doing they're doing it right!

Note to everyone, the proper way to get pizzas here is with a big party so you can try all the different ones at once!  (My personal favs are the Detroiter and the Pesto, but they're all really good.)

positive.author: Lee Mosca
positive.text: We ordered pizza here for a games night and the pizza was top notch.  All pizza‚Äôs were hot, crispy and the ingredients were well proportioned and generous!   We all enjoyed them so much.  The way pizza should be!   Pizza chefs Aly and Haleema are absolutely spot on!  Thanks so much for making our night special.

neutral.author: Rick Kaczkowski
neutral.text: Pizza tasted good...minimal toppings.  Don't think I would order from here again.

neutral.author: aaron wu
neutral.text: got a pizza there nothing special , kinda pricey compared to other pizza spots

neutral.author: Frank Peresta
neutral.text: Was excited to try but not a great Detroit style pizza. Minimal amount of cheese and the dough/sauce tastes store bought. For $50 bucks (2 cheese pizzasI expected something good. Try POW Pizza Detroit style...that is a quality pie.

negative.author: Scott Speers
negative.text:
Really bad pizza!
Wasn‚Äôt even close to authentic Detroit style pizza. Kinda pan fried a thick crust, threw a few thin toppings on and covered it with some Heinz pizza sauce out of a can. 2/10

negative.author: Steffany & Jamie
negative.text: A sadly disappointing experiences. I had high hopes for a great meaty deep dish pizza and unfortunately I was given a pizza made up of 85% dough. The flavors of the pizza were good - the the two star review relates directly to the ultra thick crust. If I wanted to eat a loaf of bread I would have gone to my local bakery and ordered a fresh of focaccia paired with a nice olive oil and balsamic. And it would have been a heck of a lot less expensive.

negative.author: Laura Cates
negative.text:
Ordered thru Uber eats.  Arrived not hot.  114  degrees.  Very. Very. Few toppings.   We thought we were ordering a loaded pizza.  Barely a skim of toppings.  Flavor is good.  Sauce is
great.  Dough is fluffy and very good.   Disappointed in temperature and amount of toppings in a 40 dollar pizza.
